00048 fsal_status_t FSAL_truncate(
00049     fsal_handle_t         * p_filehandle,         /* IN */
00050     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,            /* IN */
00051     fsal_size_t             length,               /* IN */
00052     fsal_file_t           * file_descriptor,      /* Unused in this FSAL */
00053     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_object_attributes   /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00054 ){
00055   
00056   int rc, errsv;
00057   struct stat buffstat;
00058   fsal_path_t fsalpath;
00059   fsal_status_t st;
00060       
00061   /* sanity checks.
00062    * note : object_attributes is optional.
00063    */
00064   if ( !p_filehandle || !p_context )
00065     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00066     
00067   /* get the path of the file and its POSIX information */
00068   st = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_filehandle, 0, &fsalpath, &buffstat);
00069   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st)) Return(st.major, st.minor, INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00070   
00071   /* check if it is a file */
00072   if ( !S_ISREG(buffstat.st_mode) )
00073   {
00074     Return(ERR_FSAL_INVAL ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00075   }
00076 
00077   /* Executes the POSIX truncate operation */
00078   
00079   TakeTokenFSCall();
00080   rc = truncate(fsalpath.path, length); 
00081   errsv = errno;
00082   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00083   
00084   /* convert return code */  
00085   if (rc)
00086     Return( posix2fsal_error(errsv), -errsv, INDEX_FSAL_truncate );
00087   
00088   /* Optionally retrieve attributes */
00089   if( p_object_attributes ){
00090     
00091     fsal_status_t st;
00092         
00093     st = FSAL_getattrs( p_filehandle, p_context, p_object_attributes );
00094     
00095     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00096     {
00097       FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes );
00098       FSAL_SET_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes,
00099           FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00100     }
00101 
00102   }
00103   
00104   
00105   /* No error occurred */
00106   Return(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00107   
00108 }
